author: Courtney McBride
description: President Donald Trump quipped that it would just take just one day for the US to approve the billions in advanced fighter jets, tanks and other weapons that Saudi Arabia’s crown prince has pledged to buy.
title: Trump’s Green Light of Saudi F-35s for MBS Is Only the Beginning

author: Will Wade
description: President Donald Trump plans to roll out a “Genesis Mission” as part of an executive order to boost US artificial intelligence efforts on Monday at the White House, according to a Department of Energy official.
title: Trump Plans to Unveil ‘Genesis Mission’ to Boost AI Development

author: Melissa Shin
description: Canada and its 13 provinces and territories agreed to knock down more hurdles to trading internally, as the country tries to reduce its reliance on the US amid a punishing trade war.
title: Canada Makes Trade Between Its Provinces Easier to Reduce Reliance on US

author: Gonzalo Soto
description: Mexican authorities arrested the alleged mastermind behind the murder of an outspoken local mayor that has shined a spotlight on persistent cartel-fueled violence. But the detention is unlikely to quiet growing outrage with President Claudia Sheinbaum’s crime-fighting results.
title: Sheinbaum Under Pressure After Key Arrest in Mayor’s Murder

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: Saudi Arabia Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman was in Washington this week discussing billions of dollars in weapons deals with the US. But his air force is still struggling to pay off a bill for a tiny fraction of that amount from years ago.
title: Saudi Air Force Struggles to Pay US $13 Million From Years Ago

author: Iain Marlow
description: The American President gets little in return aside from a vague investment pledge.
title: Saudi Crown Prince Leaves DC With Trump Promises of F-35s, AI Chips

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A federal judge is pressing ahead with an inquiry into whether Trump administration officials willfully defied his orders in a high-profile immigration case.
title: Judge Resumes Contempt Investigation in Trump Deportation Fight

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: The Trump administration intends to release its long-awaited plan to offer relief for beleaguered farmers early next month, US Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said Wednesday.
title: US to Announce Farm Relief Plan in Early December, Rollins Says

author: Kelcee Griffis
description: President Donald Trump’s administration has repeatedly threatened to use its power over broadcast TV licenses to police disfavored speech. Most recently, Trump renewed his call for the US Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to revoke ABC’s station licenses after a reporter for the network asked about his handling of files related to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.
title: Can Trump Take ABC Off Air? How US Broadcast Licenses Work

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Colombia said it would back a plan for Venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro to hand over power to a transition government tasked with organizing new elections.
title: Colombia Backs Plan for Maduro to Leave Power and Avoid Prison

author: Kate Sullivan
description: US President Donald Trump said he’ll “start working” on resolving the war in Sudan after a request from Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, an indication Washington may deepen its involvement in a conflict that’s killed at least 150,000 people.
title: Trump Says US to ‘Start Working’ on Ending Brutal War in Sudan

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union is exploring further restrictive measures on those enabling Russia’s so-called “shadow fleet” of tankers transporting oil in a further effort to disrupt Moscow’s ability to fund its war against Ukraine.
title: EU to Discuss Imposing New Sanctions on Russia’s Shadow Fleet

author: Michael Shepard
description: President Donald Trump stood by his stance that immigrants with high-tech skills should be allowed into the US to support the expansion of advanced domestic manufacturing, despite mounting backlash from his conservative base.
title: Trump Says US Must Allow Skilled Foreigners Despite MAGA Uproar

author: Maxwell Adler
description: A surge in artificial intelligence stock prices has boosted California’s tax collections by about $11 billion, yet the state’s deficit is still on track to swell to about $18 billion next fiscal year, officials said.
title: AI Stock Gains Boost California Revenue by $11 Billion

author: Jimmy Jenkins, Erik Larson
description: US Attorney General Pam Bondi said the Justice Department “will follow the law” after the passage of legislation compelling the government to release files on sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein.
title: Bondi Says DOJ Will ‘Follow the Law’ on Release of Epstein Files

author: Annmarie Hordern, Daniel Flatley
description: President Donald Trump suggested he would fire Scott Bessent if the Treasury secretary doesn’t help secure lower interest rates, a move that is up to the Federal Reserve and not administration officials.
title: Trump Quips He’ll Fire Bessent If Interest Rates Are Not Lowered

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis
description: Congressional Republicans are feuding over language quietly tucked into the bill ending the US government shutdown that could reap several GOP senators millions by allowing them to sue the Justice Department over telephone record seizures during the 2020 election interference probe.
title: Republicans Feud Over Law That Could Give Senators Millions

author: Bailey Lipschultz, Nicola M White
description: Rank-and-file US Securities and Exchange Commission workers have returned to face the paperwork that piled up during the longest government shutdown in US history, and supervisors say the order of the day is “triage.”
title: SEC’s Epic Post-Shutdown Filing Backlog Risks Stalling US IPOs

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Alberto Nardelli, Alex Wickham
description: A delegation of top US military officials arrived in Ukraine for talks on ways to ramp up pressure against Russia, as President Donald Trump’s team looks to renew its faltering push for a peace deal to end the war.
title: Top US Army Officials Head to Ukraine as Trump Pushes Peace

author: Alicia Diaz, Steven T. Dennis, Caitlin Reilly, Josh Wingrove
description: Republican lawmakers are resisting President Donald Trump’s proposal to send $2,000 checks to working-class households next year ahead of a midterm election cycle dominated by voters’ concerns about the cost of living and the US economy.
title: Trump’s $2,000 Tariff Check Idea  Draws Republican Resistance

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump said $270 billion in deals are being signed at a US-Saudi Investment Forum, the latest in a series of huge numbers he’s announced during this week’s visit to Washington by Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.
title: Trump Says $270 Billion in Deals Being Signed at US-Saudi Forum

author: Chris Strohm
description: The Justice Department told a federal judge Wednesday that the final indictment against former FBI Director James Comey was never shown to the full grand jury.
title: DOJ Says Final Comey Indictment Wasn’t Seen by Grand Jury

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: A key ally of Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is pushing for more power to be centralized in her hands amid a growing power struggle with Italian President Sergio Mattarella.
title: Meloni Ally Calls for Reforms to Give Prime Minister More Powers

author: J.J. McCorvey
description: President Donald Trump nominated Stuart Levenbach to be director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, according to a Congressional website.
title: Trump Nominates Levenbach for CFPB Amid Bid to Dismantle Agency

author: Arno Schuetze
description: JPMorgan Chase & Co and Deutsche Bank AG have been asked to share the financial records of Jeffrey Epstein amid a Congressional committee’s investigation into the late financier and convicted sex trafficker.
title: JPMorgan, Deutsche Bank Subpoenaed to Release Epstein Records

author: Enda Curran
description: Kevin Hassett, one of President Donald Trump’s finalists to become Federal Reserve chair, said there’s space for Congress to look at enacting tariff rebate checks next year.
title: Hassett Says Tariff Rebate Check Proposal Should Be on the Table

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: The daughter of former South African President Jacob Zuma has been involved in recruiting men from South Africa and Botswana for service with Russian forces in its war against Ukraine, according to people familiar with the situation and WhatsApp messages seen by Bloomberg.
title: Zuma’s Daughter Linked to Recruiting Africans for Russian War

author: Peter Blumberg
description: President Donald Trump continues to expand troop deployments to US cities, escalating a campaign to assert military power at home with little precedent in US history.
title: How Trump’s Use of Troops at Home Tests His Powers

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italy’s Finance Minister Giancarlo Giorgetti isn’t interested in bidding for the newly available euro-area finance chief post, but may consider backing his Spanish counterpart Carlos Cuerpo, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Italy Considers Backing Spain to Lead Euro-Area Finance Chiefs

author: Katanga Johnson
description: Travis Hill’s nomination to serve as head of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. was advanced by a Senate panel on Wednesday, moving him one step closer to a final confirmation vote by the US Senate.
title: Senate Panel Advances Travis Hill’s Nomination to Be FDIC Chair

author: Ewa Krukowska
description: European Union nations agreed to push for a one-year delay to a landmark law to curb deforestation across the world, seeking further concessions than proposed by the bloc’s executive arm.
title: EU Nations Agree to Push for One-Year Delay to Deforestation Law

author: Erik Wasson
description: The Senate on Wednesday sent the House-passed bill to compel the Justice Department to release files on sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein to President Donald Trump for his signature, capping months of effort from survivors and a rear-guard effort from members of the president’s won party.
title: Congress Officially Passes Epstein Files Bill, Sends to Trump

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Kosovo’s prime minister failed to form a new government, likely sending the Balkan nation to its second election this year after the caretaker administration exhausted all options to remain in power.
title: Kosovo to Hold Snap Vote as Premier Fails to Hold On to Power

author: Zoe Tillman
description: President Donald Trump’s administration continues to face claims that US officials are wrongfully deporting migrants in violation of court orders and other legal protections amid his ramped up immigration enforcement.
title: Trump Migrant Crackdown Spurs New Wrongful Deportation Claims

author: Michael Nienaber
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s cabinet approved legislation that enables the Bundeswehr armed forces to shoot down unidentified drones suspected of spying on military bases, industrial facilities and other critical infrastructure.
title: Germany Empowers Military to Shoot Down Drones in Emergencies

author: S'thembile Cele, Ntando Thukwana
description: The US formally warned South Africa against pushing for a joint statement at this weekend’s Group of 20 summit in Johannesburg that the Trump administration is boycotting, according to a document seen by Bloomberg.
title: US Warns South Africa Not to Issue G-20 Statement at Summit

author: Eliyahu Kamisher
description: Billionaire Tom Steyer has parlayed his $4.6 billion fortune into funding progressive causes and a failed presidential bid. He’s now running for California governor.
title: Billionaire Tom Steyer to Run for California Governor Decrying Rich

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: The United Nations atomic watchdog urged Iran to allow nuclear inspectors to resume their work, saying sites that were bombed by Israel and the US earlier this year are safe enough to visit.
title: UN Watchdog Says Iran’s Bombed Nuclear Sites Are Safe to Inspect

author: Michael Nienaber
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has no intention of apologizing over comments that were interpreted as critical of Brazilian COP30 host city Belém and triggered a furore in the South American nation, according to his spokesman.
title: Merz Won’t Apologize for Remarks That Prompted Outrage in Brazil

author: Nduka Orjinmo
description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu postponed a trip abroad to deal with security issues, after a spate of attacks including the abduction of dozens of schoolgirls, the killing of a military general and the kidnapping of churchgoers.
title: Nigeria’s President Postpones G-20 Trip Amid Security Breakdown

author: Myles Miller
description: New York City Police Commissioner Jessica Tisch will remain in her post under mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani, ensuring continuity at the top of the NYPD as the city transitions to a new administration.
title: Jessica Tisch to Remain NYPD Commissioner Under Mamdani

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union is seeking to slash permits and adapt roads in a bid to untangle the web of paperwork and routes that stalls military equipment moving across the bloc.
title: EU Wants to Cut Permits and Update Roads to Speed Military Moves

author: Greg Ryan
description: A proposal for the strictest statewide rent control policy in the US is on track to make it onto the 2026 ballot in Massachusetts.
title: Massachusetts Bid for Strictest Rent Control in US Moves Forward

author: James Woolcock
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said the UK budget announced next week would be “based on Labour values,” as speculation builds that Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will have to target the wealthy with tax hikes.
title: Starmer Says UK Budget Will Be ‘Based on Labour Values’

author: Faris Mokhtar, Claire Jiao
description: The recent US-China summit created a “much needed” temporary stabilization that will provide guardrails for the two economic superpowers to engage, said Singapore Prime Minister Lawrence Wong.
title: Trump-Xi Meeting Creates Much-Needed Stability, Wong Says

author: Nicolle Yapur, Maria Elena Vizcaino
description: As US President Donald Trump trains naval guns on the Venezuelan coastline, talk of regime change swirls in Caracas — and on Wall Street, where speculators are bidding up prices on the country’s defaulted bonds.
title: Trump’s Warships Trigger Rally in Venezuela’s Defaulted Bonds

author: Ellen Milligan
description: A Russian spy ship on the edge of UK waters pointed lasers at British pilots for the first time in a “deeply dangerous” escalation, Defense Secretary John Healey revealed as he warned of military options if the vessel travels further.
title: Russian Spy Ship Points Lasers at British Pilots for First Time

author: Irina Anghel
description: House prices in Kensington and Chelsea fell by almost £160,000 ($210,000) in the year to September, as the capital’s housing market reels from expected tax hikes in the Labour government budget next week.
title: House Prices Crash Across London’s Wealthiest Neighborhoods

author: Maciej Martewicz, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukraine is ready to share intelligence with Poland on the recent sabotage of a railway line and other security threats, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said in response to Polish Premier Donald Tusk.
title: Zelenskiy Backs Poland’s Call for Joint Work on Threats

author: Alan Crawford
description: American president’s top lieutenants offer insights into his emerging international doctrine.
title: US Foreign-Policy Twins Jostle for Trump’s Ear

author: Yongchang Chin, Weilun Soon
description: A surge in bookings for oil tankers to bring cargoes from the Middle East to India points to higher import flows ahead, as sanctions on major Russian producers force the South Asian importer to seek alternatives.
title: India Seeks Ships for Mideast Oil as Sanctions Deadline Looms

author: Francine Lacqua, Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland’s top trade diplomat expressed her country’s heartfelt desire for UBS Group AG not to move abroad.
title: Switzerland Loves UBS and Wants It to Stay, Top Trade Negotiator Says

author: Galit Altstein
description: One of Israel’s biggest defense firms expects the ceasefire in Gaza to boost sales to Europe, as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government seeks to increase military exports to stimulate economic growth.
title: Israeli Defense Firm Elbit Sees Export Boost on Gaza Ceasefire

author: Alex Longley
description: An oil tanker that was seized by Iranian forces last week as been freed, the vessel’s manager said.
title: Oil Tanker Seized by Iran Has Been Released, Manager Says

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: A former top-ranking Philippine cabinet minister said he was forced out of office earlier this week, contradicting a statement from the president’s office that he voluntarily quit, as the nation’s corruption scandal deepens.
title: Philippine Ex-Cabinet Official Says He Was Forced to Quit

author: Sven Beckert
description: Trump’s brand of economic nationalism echoes policies that led to two world wars and the rise of authoritarian regimes across the globe.
title: Where Will ‘America First’ Lead Us? The Answer From History: Nowhere Good

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Poland will close Russia’s consulate in the northern city of Gdansk and announce a further response to an explosion on a key rail link to Kyiv within days, Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski said.
title: Poland to Close Russian Consulate in Response to Rail Blast

author: Patrick Van Oosterom, Sarah Jacob
description: The Dutch government suspended its powers over chipmaker Nexperia, restoring control to its Chinese owner and defusing a standoff with Beijing that had begun to hamper automotive production around the world.
title: Dutch Hand Back Control of Chinese-Owned Chipmaker Nexperia

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Russia launched a massive missile and drone attack on Ukraine, triggering emergency power cuts in parts of the country, as Moscow continues to target energy infrastructure ahead of winter.
title: Russia Strike on Ukraine Kills Nine After Apartment Building Hit

author: Khine Lin Kyaw
description: Myanmar’s military government seized nearly 10,000 mobile phones and related equipment that it said were used in online fraud during a crackdown on scam centers near the Thai border.
title: Myanmar Seizes 10,000 Phones in Online Scams Crackdown

author: Grace Sihombing, Prima Wirayani
description: Indonesia’s central bank left its benchmark interest rate unchanged for a second straight month in a move that may provide support for the rupiah, the worst-performing currency this year in Asia, while signaling there’s likely room for further cuts.
title: Bank Indonesia Holds Key Rate Again But Signals Openness to Cuts

author: Sanne Wass
description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen’s Social Democrats suffered a major setback in local elections held across the country, losing the capital after more than a century in power.
title: Danish Premier’s Party Loses Century-Long Hold on Copenhagen

author: Lucille Liu, Alicia Diaz
description: Senator Steve Daines is planning to lead a delegation of his fellow US legislators to China during the first half of next year, according to people familiar with the matter, in what would be a high-profile visit that reflects improving ties between the rival superpowers.
title: Trump Ally Is Eyeing High-Level Senator Visit to China Next Year

author: Alan Wong, Fran Wang
description: Former US Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said President Donald Trump’s tariffs are likely to outlive his administration, sustained by political fears that removing protectionist barriers will alienate workers who fear losing their jobs to off-shoring and AI.
title: Raimondo Says Trump’s Tariffs Hard to Remove for Next President

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korea is stepping up its outreach to Middle Eastern buyers as it pursues potential weapons contracts worth $15 billion in the United Arab Emirates, seeking to build on its success in Europe and solidify its reputation as a dependable arms supplier.
title: South Korea Eyes $15 Billion UAE Arms Deal in Middle East Push

author: Kate Sullivan, Catherine Lucey, Eric Martin
description: The US vice president and secretary of state have divergent styles. Both are building credentials on the world stage as potential successors to Trump.
title: Vance and Rubio Offer Clues to Trump’s Foreign Policy — and the 2028 Race

author: Zoe Schneeweiss
description: Three quarters of Swiss voters are expected to reject a new inheritance tax targeted at the super rich, according to a poll ahead of a plebiscite later this month.
title: Swiss Set to Reject Inheritance Tax on Super Rich, Poll Shows

author: Ari Natter
description: US negotiations with Saudi Arabia on a long-sought nuclear technology-sharing deal have been completed, potentially opening the door for American companies to build reactors in the kingdom.
title: US Reaches Initial Deal With Saudi Arabia on Nuclear Sharing

author: Gregory Korte
description: Elon Musk returned to the White House Tuesday in a sign that tensions between President Donald Trump and the world’s richest man have thawed since a fierce split over deficit spending earlier this year fractured their once-cozy relationship.
title: Elon Musk Returns to White House as Tensions Thaw With Trump

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: The Bank of Japan governor is set to meet with key cabinet ministers in a gathering that’s likely to discuss the government’s joint accord with the central bank.
title: BOJ’s Ueda to Meet With Finance, Growth Strategy Ministers

author: Jen Judson
description: Rare-earths startup Vulcan Elements announced it will use $1 billion of government funding and private capital to build a production facility in its home state of North Carolina, the latest step in a US push to break free of China’s grip over the industry.
title: Vulcan Elements Picks North Carolina Base for Rare Earths Plant

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Kate Sullivan, Tyler Kendall
description: President Donald Trump said he would formally designate Saudi Arabia as a major non-NATO ally in a further strengthening of ties between the two countries, capping a day of dealmaking between the US leader and the kingdom’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.
title: Trump Calls Saudi Arabia a Major Non-NATO Ally in Boost to MBS

author: Claire Jiao
description: Singapore’s top diplomat said that tensions between the US and China appeared to be in a “tactical pause,” warning that a partial decoupling of the economic giants was inevitable if they’re unable to rebuild trust.
title: Singapore Sees ‘Tactical Pause’ in Tensions Between US and China

author: Jasmine Ng
description: A senior Chinese diplomat indicated that talks aimed at easing tensions between China and Japan did not go well, suggesting the dispute over Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s comments on Taiwan is unlikely to fade soon.
title: Chinese Diplomat ‘Dissatisfied’ With Japan Talks as Rift Deepens
